广告牌 https://www.billboard.com音乐排行榜、新闻、照片和视频2024 年 11 月 8 日星期五 16:20:26 +0000 en-US每小时1 https://wordpress.org/?v=6.5.5 200641670 2025 年格莱美提名中的冷落和惊喜https://www.billboard.com/lists/grammy-snubs-surprises-2025-nominations/Paul Grein Fri, 08 Nov 2024 16:20:16 +0000 AwardsMusicGrammy NominationsGrammys https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=pmc_list&p=1235823123 André 3000, Hozier, Cher and LISA from Blackpink are among the artists who either did better or worse than expected.

2025 年格莱美提名的大部分内容都与预期相符。我们都知道碧昂斯、 比莉·艾利什和泰勒·斯威夫特会表现出色，他们也确实做到了，各自获得了年度专辑、年度唱片和年度歌曲的提名。 萨布丽娜·卡彭特 (Sabrina Carpenter)和查佩尔·罗恩 (Chappell Roan)还分别获得了这三个主要类别的提名，以及最佳新人奖（横扫了通常被称为四大类别的奖项）。

但格莱美提名中总会有冷落和意外——今年也不例外。

波斯特·马龙获得了七项提名，但他唯一的四大提名是他与斯威夫特合作的热门歌曲《双周》(Fortnight)，该歌曲将角逐年度唱片和年度歌曲。他自己的专辑《F-1 Trillion 》未能获得年度专辑提名。

Shaboozey的乡村/嘻哈混合歌曲《A Bar Song (Tipsy)》连续 16 周位居 Billboard Hot 100 榜首，尽管获得了年度歌曲提名，但未能获得年度唱片提名。 Lady Gaga和Bruno Mars的时髦民谣《Die With a Smile》在 Hot 100 中排名第二，也经历了同样的命运。因此，在这两种情况下，冷落都因另一个重要类别的提名而得到缓解。

四大类别的竞争非常激烈。今年，共有780人入围年度唱片，707人入围年度专辑，978人入围年度专辑，323人入围最佳新人。

以下是 2025 年格莱美提名中一些值得注意的冷落和意外。

; 1235823123 MTV EMA 执行制片人布鲁斯·吉尔默 (Bruce Gillmer) 谈论拥抱拉丁和韩国流行音乐、保持相关性并向利亚姆·佩恩 (Liam Payne) 致敬https://www.billboard.com/pro/mtv-ema-2024-executive- Producer-bruce-gillmer-interview-billboard/Paul Grein Fri, 08 Nov 2024 16:18:48 +0000 AwardsMusiceuropeInternationalMTV EMAMTV EMAs https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235823424 The show's returning host, Rita Ora, had a global hit with the late pop star in 2018.

伦敦——11 月 10 日星期日，第 30 届年度 MTV 欧洲音乐奖 (EMA) 将于英国曼彻斯特市的Co-op Live 竞技场举行。该节目由丽塔·奥拉 (Rita Ora ) 主持，LE SSERAFIM、Peso Pluma、Tyla、Benson Boone、RAYE、Shawn Mendes、Teddy Swims、The Warning 和Pet Shop Boys 等乐队将献上表演，他们将获得首届 MTV EMA 流行先锋奖。

2024 年 EMA 将在近 150 个国家/地区的 MTV 全球网络上进行现场直播，并可在 Pluto TV 和 Paramount+ 上观看，该活动的执行制片人兼音乐与音乐总裁Bruce Gillmer表示，2024 年 EMA 有望成为一场“令人惊叹的全球音乐庆典”。 MTV 母公司 Paramount+ 的音乐首席内容官。

吉尔默表示，继去年原定在巴黎举行的 EMA 因与以色列-哈马斯战争有关的全球安全原因而被取消后，今年的第 30 届将更加特别。 “对于这部剧的回归，人们有很多被压抑的兴奋，”他在接受《公告牌》独家采访时说道。

有关的

以泰勒·斯威夫特 (Taylor Swift) 为首的女性艺术家主导 2024 年 MTV EMA 提名：以下是……

10/08/2024

这将是 2022 年以来的首次 EMA。时隔两年回归，您是否感到如释重负？

整个团队，人数不少，有几百人，个个都精神抖擞。我们这里有一个非常紧密的团队。这就像一个家庭，我们中的一些人已经两年没有见面了。所以，我想说的是兴奋是狂热的。脸上有很多幸福的笑容。我们非常高兴来到曼彻斯特，这座城市拥有如此深厚的音乐根源和对 MTV 品牌至关重要的表演，例如 Oasis 或 Joy Division。身处一座音乐之城总是令人惊叹，而这座音乐之城真的很深。最重要的是，我们还有一个令人难以置信的全新场地 Co-op Live，它是世界上唯一专门为音乐建造的场地之一。因此，休假一年带来了很多兴奋、不同的创意[处理]和令人惊叹的全新场地——所以我们赢了。

年度活动和颁奖典礼在跳过一年时总是存在失去动力的危险。您如何降低这种风险？

我认为我们很幸运拥有 MTV 品牌，并且在派拉蒙内部我们举办了一些规模最大、最重要的活动。对于我们来说，我们发现了更多的热情和渴望加入我们的旅程。无论是人才方面、音乐产业方面、我们的导演和灯光设计师还是我们使用的供应商。我们很幸运。我们并没有失去动力。我认为我们的势头有所增强。

传统上，MTV 最大的音乐颁奖典礼是 VMA。 EMA 与美国同类展会相比如何？您对这两个展会的处理方式有何不同？

这肯定是有交叉的，因为它们都是全球性的节目，而且两场节目中的大多数（如果不是全部）演员都具有全球影响力。但我想说，我们在 EMA 上更深入地了解全球。今年我们邀请了来自非洲的泰拉。我们有来自墨西哥的 Peso Pluma。当然，我们有像 Raye 这样伟大的英国艺术家和伟大的美国艺术家，还有 LE SSERAFIM 等韩国流行音乐艺术家和拉丁艺术家。感觉它可能在全球范围内更加平衡，尽管我不想让你相信 VMA 并不是全球性的，因为它确实是全球性的。但 EMA 有一些额外的能量。一些真正传达全球信息的额外元素。这两场演出都非常重要，并且都具有全球影响力。但 EMA 的目的是成为一场全球性的展会，而 VMA 则给人一种全球化的感觉，因为其中的人才具有全球影响力。

有关的

宠物店男孩将在 2024 年 MTV EMA 上荣获流行先锋奖

10/30/2024

2024 年举办大型颁奖典礼面临的最大挑战是什么？

大部分挑战在于经济。一切都一天比一天贵。人工更贵。材料比较贵。我们有来自世界各地的人才，他们受到了非常重大的影响。不幸的是，全世界都在感受到经济的低迷，所以这是我们最大的障碍。这不是一场廉价的演出，我们也没有逐年增加预算的好处。因此，我们必须制作一个成本更高的节目，同时[与前几年]具有相同的娱乐水平，但[资金]要少得多。但是，就像我说的，我们的团队非常棒。

2024 年是 EMA 成立 30 周年。您认为该活动持久受欢迎的关键是什么？

第一年，即 1994 年，整个演出都是在柏林勃兰登堡门现场直播的。 Prince 和 Aerosmith [表演]。汤姆·琼斯主持。乔治·迈克尔[表演]《自由》。在接下来的几年里，世界上最伟大的艺术家都登上了我们的舞台：麦当娜、詹妮弗·洛佩兹、夏奇拉、麦莉、阿姆、大卫·鲍伊、邦·乔维，你可以继续列举下去。我们对 30 周年纪念感到非常自豪，而且我们已经去过欧洲大约 25 个城市。我们有一些令人难以置信的主持人：海蒂·克拉姆、萨莎·拜伦·科恩两次、凯蒂·佩里两次、艾德·希兰、赛琳娜·戈麦斯。我们一直拥有来自欧洲、英国和美国的顶尖人才，该节目比以往任何时候都更强大，并且在数字时代具有比以往更广泛的影响力。当我们查看正在投票的视频类别时，会发现有数亿张选票。这么多年过去了，这部剧在全球范围内吸引了比以往任何时候都多的粉丝，而且非常健康。

自 1994 年首届 EMA 颁奖典礼以来的三十年间，全球电视转播的颁奖典礼数量大幅增加。您如何在竞争如此激烈的市场中脱颖而出？您认为颁奖典礼仍然与当今的观众相关吗？

我感觉有些是，有些不是。 [派拉蒙]很幸运能够成为格莱美奖、VMA 奖和 EMA 奖的举办地。我们的这些节目非常重要，能够与观众和艺术家建立联系。我觉得它们非常相关，并且在过去几年中这些节目变得越来越大。有几年，他们的观众数量都在大幅流失。但在过去几年里，这一趋势正在上升。格莱美奖、VMA 奖、EMA 奖在过去几年里都名列前茅。真正重要并与观众、粉丝和人才真正联系在一起的核心节目表现良好。但当你进入那种环境时，你会看到很多其他人一起过来，看到成功，突然之间，活动景观变得拥挤起来。 [并且]并非所有人都表现出色。我认为，那些没有太多历史或存在理由的人正在挣扎。

今年的 EMA 主持人丽塔·奥拉 (Rita Ora) 此前曾与利亚姆·佩恩 (Liam Payne) 录制过一首歌曲——2018 年的《For You (Fifty Shades Freed)》。您会在剧中向上个月从布宜诺斯艾利斯酒店阳台坠落身亡的前单向明星致敬吗？

显然，利亚姆是一位与我们的核心观众、甚至我们的一些员工和主持人丽塔·奥拉关系非常密切的艺术家。我们必须对它的时机有点敏感。一切都很新。所以，我们不想做任何越界的事情。但是，可以肯定的是，人们会承认他的去世。考虑到他与观众的联系以及他对品牌的意义，这是合适的。

; 1235823424 2025 年格莱美提名：查看完整列表https://www.billboard.com/music/awards/grammy-nominations-2025-full-list-1235823165/Katie Atkinson Fri, 08 Nov 2024 16:18:40 +0000 AwardsMusicGrammysMusic News https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235823165 Beyoncé leads all 2025 Grammy nominees with 11 nods, with Charli XCX, Billie Eilish, Kendrick Lamar & Post Malone securing seven nominations.

当第 67 届格莱美奖提名于周五上午（11 月 8 日）公布时，碧昂斯成为该奖项历史上获得提名最多的艺人，打破了与丈夫 Jay-Z 的平局。

碧昂斯 (Beyonce) 获得 11 项新提名，是参加 2025 年格莱美颁奖典礼的艺术家中获得提名最多的。接下来是Charli XCX 、 Billie Eilish 、 Kendrick Lamar和Post Malone ，各获 7 次点头，其次是Sabrina Carpenter 、 Chappell Roan和Taylor Swift ，各获 6 次点头。

Bey 目前已获得 99 项提名（也是格莱美历史上获奖最多的艺人，共获得 32 座奖杯）。新的提名遍布多个格莱美领域，这得益于她 2024 年风格迥异的专辑《Cowboy Carter》 ，该专辑获得了三项综合提名（年度专辑，以及主打单曲“Texas Hold 'Em”的年度唱片和年度歌曲）。以及乡村类别的四项提名，流行音乐类别的两项提名，说唱类别的一项提名，美国类别的一项提名。

卡彭特和罗恩加入了在所有四大类别中获得提名的精英艺术家俱乐部，两人都争夺年度最佳新人及专辑（分别是《Short n' Sweet》和《中西部公主的兴衰》） 、年度唱片（Carpenter 的“Espresso”和 Roan 的“Good Luck, Babe！”）和年度歌曲（Carpenter 的“Please Please Please”与“Good Luck,宝贝！”）。

下面是 2025 年格莱美奖提名的完整名单，该奖项将于 2 月 2 日星期日返回洛杉矶 Crypto.com 竞技场。

; 1235823165 AB-Soul Talks Talks“ Soul Burger”专辑，他的病毒Drake Tweet＆Kendrick Lamar的Pop Out https://www.billboard.com/music/rb-hip-hop/ab-soul-soul-soul-burger-album-album-drake-kendrick-lamar-1235821938/Michael Saponara Fri, 08 Nov 2024 16:07:29 +0000 MusicR&B/Hip-HopMusic News https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235821938 Dedicated to his late friend Armon "Doe Burger" Stringer, the latest chapter in the Top Dawg Entertainment rapper's career arrived on Friday (Nov. 8).

Ab-Soul的密友，合作者和Yin对他的Yang Armon“ Doe Burger” Stringer于2021年去世，苏洛（Soulo）随身携带了Tastemaker的精神，直到今天。这位37岁的年轻人将他的第六张录音室专辑献给了斯特林格（Stringer）作为灵魂汉堡（Soul Burger） - AB-Soul and Doe的融合 - 在星期五（11月9日）播放了流媒体服务。

下午在西海岸的近2:00 pm，当他用广告牌打电话打电话时，AB-Soul还没有睡觉。 “我是最不幸的抒情诗人和最多的MC，我以自己为荣，但是现在我该怎么做才能触摸更多的人并将其进一步呢？” DAWG娱乐说唱歌手的顶级询问。

在过去的十年中，苏洛（Soulo）证明了自己10次是说唱中的精英词匠和致命的笔，但他的使命与Soul Burger有所不同。

他说：“这是为了使人群跳跃，更多地关注这种感觉，而不是脑部。 ” “我认为昆西·琼斯（Quincy Jones）说，'你必须给上帝留下一点空间。'我一直在击败自己的墙上击败自己的比喻，而不是表达自己。”

地下皇帝征求了各种各样的建议，并在工作室中挑战了自己，同时组装了多功能的客人，例如ty dolla $ ign，doechii，doechii，doechii，doechii，vince staples，blxst，jid，lupe fiasco，以及更多地加入了LP，在LP上加入了LP，这是该公司像腹部的开场场景一样开始电影。

在职业生涯中，粉丝们希望可以永远持续到一定的时刻。苏洛（Soulo）在六月的六月里享受了其中一位，当时他在舞台上加入了前TDE兄弟肯德里克·拉马尔（Kendrick Lamar） ，在舞台上，他们一起在舞台上敲打“洛杉矶6:16”。 “要让他把我拉上舞台并将其踢向我，这让我觉得他正在和我核对，看看他是否仍然得到它。就像他正在寻找我的认可一样，”他反映。 “那是我们的关系。”

在下面找到更多的AB-Soul，详细介绍了他的第一个广告牌热门100热门单曲“ Pi”如何进入J. Cole的手中，除了他解释了他的病毒Drake “ Redemption”推文，并与Stevens-Johnson综合征一起作为说唱歌手。

我听说您说这是一个灵魂汉堡项目，而不是一个“ AB-Soul项目”。您能解释一下当您创造性地参与其中的区别与您要做的事情之间的区别吗？

从本质上讲，这是对我兄弟Doe Burger的颂歌。如果您熟悉我，您应该熟悉他，因此Soul Burger这个名字。它应该充当我和他的融合。我们在很多方面都是阴和阳。我真的很想让他尽力与我保持联系。我经常这样说，但我不知道没有他，我会怎么做。我唯一合乎逻辑的解释是他必须和我在一起。这是我觉得他要我制作的专辑。他是一个真正的品味制造者。我重视他的意见。真正的艺术家本身。我真的希望他会为此感到自豪。

万能汉堡万岁。我想从开瓶器“ 9英里”开始一些曲目。我觉得自己正走进腹部的开场场景。

老实说，我希望它进来并感觉像腹部。这实际上是我最近一直在练习的。只是不想想到这么多并带有这种感觉。只需尝试将音乐补充更多，而不是重点关注我的意思。我是天生的诗人。我写了一百万次押韵一百万次。我一直在挑战自己真正引起氛围。补充音乐与我想传达的抒情，隐喻，打孔线和比喻的内容。它一直在为我工作。我在整个职业生涯中一直很诚实。我分享了我的证词。我觉得对我来说，听到我在说音乐时说什么更为重要。

确实。我知道您正在和DJ Hed谈论要在这里作为地下皇帝进行一些bos的问题。就像您想在另一个层面上竞争那个对话。详细说明您要制造的海拔。

只是挑战自己接受建议，协作并提出问题。我一直是最不幸的抒情诗和最多的MC，我以自己为荣，但是我现在该怎么做才能触摸更多的人并进一步呢？为什么不选择这种艺术形式可以得到的一切呢？在各个层面上竞争。它仍然尽力不妥协让我来到这里的精神，但是我该如何进一步呢？

自2012年控制系统以来，这种谦卑和愿意挑战自己的意愿是令人兴奋的。

我很高兴你这么说。我无法击败控制系统。这是我们进一步采取目标的目标。我必须击败控制系统。我需要有人参考我的另一个项目。控制系统是一个频率，人。那时候它只是纯粹的饥饿。我并不担心数字或业务。我真的做了我想做的事。我做了我想毫不犹豫地制作的艺术，我正在努力回到这一点。

您在今年早些时候与J. Cole的“ Pi”首次亮相Billboard Hot 100。我知道整个背景故事，您不知道科尔最终会得到[以后可能删除]的记录。自从你们如何很快就会吧，您是否与他进行过交谈，以便很快就会带吧台？

每日，他现在是团队的一员。他与我们紧密合作，尤其是拳打。大喊到房间里到处都是镜子。我和他很亲密，我们在一些抒情的练习中进行了一次陪练的会议。之所以称为“ Pi”，是因为这首歌以讽刺的是在三分钟14秒时结束。这是在战斗和所有这些之前就完成的。他把它寄给了科尔，我不知道。这是[日报]的记录。我有一天早上醒了，我的手机上有一个疯狂的J. Cole经文。我想，“兄弟什么？你必须让我知道。这是世界上最好的说唱歌手之一。”

我和科尔有一个小问题，因为他应该在我的上一张专辑《赫伯特》中。科尔是一位真正的艺术家，他可能不能只是抓住这种氛围 - 这就是证明，因为他立即被这一位动机激励了。真正的说唱歌手的说唱歌手。我立即打电话给他，“兄弟，我需要我的后卫。”我们都非常酷。整个Dreamville营地。他尊重这一点。他受到启发与吉迪斯（Jedis）进行锁定，然后将我们飞往[亚特兰大]。这是浓汤，我们都必须建立和创建。他有那种精神。我直截了当地告诉他：“我们必须抓住。”在星星对齐时，在神圣的时机中。

在与肯德里克（Kendrick）一起弹出的“洛杉矶6:16”的说法，当您回头看时，那一刻对您意味着什么？

这不仅是我最喜欢的唱片之一。除了牛肉之外，这是一个如此美丽的唱片。他说的是如此深刻的话。就像我最喜欢的台词一样，“当我失去时，有机会在我跌倒时发现自己。” He was talking to all of us. That was more than a battle. He had me looking myself in the mirror. It was larger than that and that's what the Pop Out ended up being. He took a battle and used it as an opportunity to unify.太棒了。 He was kicking that s–t. I'm not playing about Dot. I've learned so much from him and all my brothers. I don't expect nothing from him, and that was an honor and a privilege.

You said “redemption was not off the table for Drake” and you got a lot of backlash, so I wanted to ask you about the months since and how he's moved.

I'm actually glad you asked that. I did get a lot of blowback from that. I kind of was impulsive with my response. You know how the internet come. If you read it properly, I began with a Dot quote and ended with a Dot quote. It goes back to me saying that was more than a battle for me. That battle had me looking myself in the mirror. It felt it was more than just about his opponent it was something for us all to learn from. That was intelligent movement. It got personal, but that has nothing to do with me.

What I was saying was everyone coming to me all my homies asking me how I felt about it. I'm just hearing all of these opinions and stuff like that and I just got tired of it. I was saying, if Drake is one if the top MCs where the industry and media put him — these guys are superstars. I tread light speaking on these guys. Dot is my brother and I don't expect nothing less from him. I'm biased, but he did what he does. But I'm saying if Drake is the MC that I hope he can be, then redemption is not off the table. You know who the gang is. Dot whooped feet.

I don't know what everybody thought I was trying to do. It was obvious he got worked. All we talk about is loss. Dot was in the battle talking about his losses. Talking about his shortcomings.我觉得那很美。 Especially me, myself as an artist, I put it on the table. I share my testimony. I share my shortcomings. If Drake is an MC, then get up and rap. Let's keep it hip-hop, keep it on wax, keep it clean. I come from that. I used to battle in the street. I battled Daylyt on my album. This what we do. At the end of the day, I want to make it clear, you know who the gang is.

There's no nuance on the internet. People take things out of context and they run with stuff. I'm like, “Man, he's making a good point here. I wish he could explain this and keep going off it.” It's a good conversation to be had.

If you a real MC, like I feel he wanna be, get up. Sometimes you box with the homies and you get put on your pockets and you get up and fight again.我不认识那个人。上帝保佑他。 He'll be alright, he a superstar. But the homie whooped feet, I'm not sorry.

How did you link up with Jhené Aiko? I love this quote she had, “If I was solely a rapper, I'd be Ab-Soul.”

That's really my sister from way back. She was with us in the trenches. She was really pulling up to the headquarters back in the day. We got a lot of music together. She would share me her records and let me check her flow. She can rap too. She's a lyricist. It's beautiful seeing her ascension. She put a lot of work in. I love to see it.当之无愧。 That's my Pisces sister.

Living with Stevens-Johnson Syndrome, what has been the toughest part of navigating being an artist? Have you had any other artists lean on you or look at you as inspiration?

I haven't run into any other artists, personally, that have had that. I've seen an artist that has had it. I believe it was a female artist that is a Stevens-Johnson Syndrome survivor. When I got it, it was very new so I'm sure they got a better grip on it now. It's just a blessing I'm still able and I don't let it handicap me. I'm blessed to have strong family and friends. People who love me and encourage me to keep going.

Travis Kelce might be a three-time Super Bowl champion, but to many parts of the world, he'll always be Taylor Swift 's boyfriend first and foremost.

Jason Kelce Says He's 'Not Proud' of Incident With Heckler Who Bashed Travis Kelce for Dating…

And on a recent episode, Jeopardy! poked fun at the 35-year-old Kansas City Chiefs tight end's celebrity status with a cheeky clue: “ Are You Smarter Than a Celebrity? is hosted by this man who's maybe more famous as a bf than as a 3-time Super Bowl champ.”

The prompt was certainly enough for a contestant named Derek to correctly lock in his answer — “Who is Travis Kelce?” — adding $200 to his tally.危险！ later posted a photo of the clue and wrote, “Sorry to this man 😆”

Kelce hasn't said anything about the clue, but based on his past comments about his superstar girlfriend, he'd probably find the game show's classification funny. In the same interview, the New Heights host also raved that “literally, every single one” of the 14-time Grammy winner's songs is his favorite. “If you see me at a concert, you'll see me singing them all,” he added.

Indeed, Kelce has been to quite a few Eras Tour concerts since he started dating Swift last summer. He most recently attended her second night in Indianapolis Nov. 2, after which he said on his podcast, “I wanted to see Tay one more time before this thing got closed up.”

“I'll tell you what, man,” he added of her show — one of Swift's last before Eras wraps up in December — on the Nov. 6 New Heights episode . “美国人群，他们并没有令人失望。我听说这一次更加吵闹，因为我知道她将在巡演结束前最后一次穿越美国回来，我来告诉你，伙计，那东西很摇摆。 Absolutely rocking.”

; 1235823409 50 Cent's 'Candy Shop' Welcomed Into YouTube Billion-Views Club https://www.billboard.com/music/rb-hip-hop/50-cent-candy-shop-youtube-one-billion-views-1235823418/Gil Kaufman Fri, 08 Nov 2024 16:04:38 +0000 MusicR&B/Hip-HopMusic Newsyoutube https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235823418 The song appeared on 50's second album, 2005's "The Massacre."

50 Cent has landed his second video in the YouTube billion-views club. The rapper's 2005 hit “Candy Shop” now joins his signature breakthrough 2003 hit “In Da Club” in the 10-digit realm. The Scott Storch-produced second single from 50's sophomore album, The Massacre — which spent nine weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 — features singer Olivia on the hook.

50 Cent Reacts to Donald Trump's Presidential Election Victory: 'Leaving With the Winner…

The Jesse Terrero-directed video opens with the MC pulling up to Candy Shop Lane in a red Ferrari, where the gates open to reveal an enormous mansion filled with video vixens. When 50 opens the door, he's greeted by a series of scantily clad women as he raps the single-entendre hook, “I take you to the candy shop/ I'll let you lick the lollipop/ Go 'head girl, don't you stop/ Keep goin' until you hit the spot,” over the song's snaky, dance-y beat.

Elsewhere, an eager-looking 50 hits the sheets and the doctor's office with women dressed up as domanatrixes, nurses and in lingerie in the clip that features cameos from Lil Scrappy and the G-Unit's Young Buck and Lloyd Banks. Rocking a grey G-Unit cap, 50 also flexes in a grey fur coat and watches as Olivia and a group of dancers give him a private show while dressed in skin-baring red satin booty shorts and bikini tops, with some later posing like a living painting behind him.

The party ends when Olivia pops a bubblegum bubble in 50's ear, which zooms out to reveal the singer working at a drive-thru fast food window asking a sleeping Curtis to wake up from his raunchy reverie to realize he's dozed off in the line at… you guessed it, the Candy Shop.

“Candy Shop” marked 50's third No. 1 single in two years, following up on “In Da Club” — which also spent nine weeks on the top of the Hot 100 tally — as well as 2003's “21 Questions,” featuring Nate Dogg 。

; 1235823418 Ed Sheeran Pays Tribute to Outgoing Warner Music Exec Max Lousada at MBW Music Business UK Awards https://www.billboard.com/pro/ed-sheeran-tribute-ougoing-warner-music-exec-max-lousada-watch/Chris Eggertsen Fri, 08 Nov 2024 16:00:00 +0000 BusinessBusiness NewsAtlantic RecordsMax LousadaMBW Music Business UK Awards https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235823037 "For real art to thrive, we need real people like him in the music industry fighting for it," said Sheeran while presenting Lousada with the Sir George Martin Award.

Before hitting the stage to receive the Sir George Martin Award at MBW's Music Business UK Awards in London on Tuesday night (Nov. 5), outgoing Warner Music Group CEO of recorded music Max Lousada was introduced by someone who truly needs no introduction: longtime Atlantic Records superstar Ed Sheeran , who characterized Lousada as part of a rare and dying breed.

“When I got asked to introduce this award tonight, Max had just been let go of by Warner, and I wanted to make sure that I was here to say they don't make people like him anymore. Music people,” said Sheeran, who noted it had always been his “dream” to be signed to Atlantic: “All my heroes and all the people that I aspired to be were all housed there.”

有关的

Max Lousada, Outgoing Warner Music CEO of Recorded Music, Pens Goodbye Note to Staff

2024年9月27日

Sheeran went on to list some of the artists whose careers Lousada was personally instrumental in launching — “from The Darkness to Stormzy , to James Blunt , Coldplay , Dua Lipa and beyond” — before making a call for the industry to support more young executives who can carry on his legacy. “The industry is at risk of becoming reactionary, rather than just following heart and gut feelings on things that are just good,” he continued. “I really hope young people who are like Max are nurtured in the future, because for real art to thrive, we need real people like him in the music industry fighting for it.”

While accepting the award, Lousada said he was inspired in his own career by the example of the legendary George Martin and his work at Parlophone Records: “What he built was this kind of ever-welcoming shelter for unconventional minds, and that was something that has struck me and has been my North Star, the people that don't quite seem to fit in.”

“It's not just that [Martin] himself was a complete one-off, a maverick,” Lousada continued. “It's that when he saw originality, he leaned into it hard.当有些人看到不称职时，他看到了开拓者。他从未试图塑造他的艺术家以适合模具。他试图将其与他们分解成碎片。而且我一直受到这种创造性的勇敢的启发。 And if I'm honest, that kind of creative bravery is what we need more and more.”

You can watch the full clip above.

; 1235823037 DJ Chubb E. Swagg Details the Music Behind Kamala Harris' Howard University 2024 Election Events: 'I Wanted to Tell a Story About Perseverance' https://www.billboard.com/music/rb-hip-hop/dj-chubb-e-swagg-kamala-harris-howard-university-2024-election-1235823159/Kyle-Brandon Denis Fri, 08 Nov 2024 15:57:51 +0000 MusicR&B/Hip-Hopelection 2024musichttps://www.billboard.com/?p=1235823159 The award-winning DJ breaks down how he built a setlist to prepare an emotional crowd for the Vice President's concession speech. Read the Billboard interview.;

From Charli XCX 's momentum-shifting “Kamala is brat” post to Beyoncé and Kendrick Lamar 's “Freedom” serving as her official campaign song, music was integral to Vice President Kamala Harris' 2024 bid for the US presidency.

有关的

What Can Kamala Harris' Presidential Campaign Tell Us About the Current State of Pop Fandom?

2024年8月14日

On Election Day (Nov. 5), Vice President Harris returned to her beloved alma mater, Howard University, to observe the election results and spend the historic night at the place where she first ran for office. Though former President Donald Trump would ultimately win the election, Harris still chose to concede and end her campaign with dignity and grace on her undergraduate campus.

To soundtrack both Election Night and the hours leading up to the VP's concession speech, the Harris campaign selected DJ Chubb E. Swag (born Terrell D. Williams) – another Cali-bred Howard student who has played gigs ranging from Nipsey Hussle tours to the wedding of Vanessa Bell Calloway's daughter. “I used to be Nipsey Hussle 's tour DJ years ago, back in 2012 and part of 2013,” he tells Billboard . “We did some important work together and I did one of his last shows before he transitioned into the Crenshaw situation.”

Though his DJ career has brought him to stages around the world, very few gigs can compare to preparing the stage for a sitting Vice President – let alone in the context of one of the most mind-boggling election cycles in US history. Tasked with keeping hope alive during Election Night and curating the mood for a concession speech sure to break the hearts of millions of listeners, DJ Chubb E. Swag turned to the healing power of Black music to tell his own story and Vice President Harris formally ended她的竞选活动。 From The Isley Brothers ' “Shout” and Chaka Khan 's “What Cha' Gonna Do For Me” to Beyoncé's “America Has a Problem” and Lamar's “Alright,” DJ Chubb E. Swagg curated a setlist brimming with hope and resistance in the face of complete and utter despair.

In an illuminating conversation with Billboard , DJ Chubb E. Swagg details how he rose to the occasion of emceeing Election Night and the following day, the legacy of Howard DJs and breaking “Swag Surfin” on the storied campus.

What's your history with Howard?

I went to Howard University from 2008 until around 2013. 2012 was when I started going on tour with Nipsey, after which I had ceased to go to school for a second. I came back for a little when I was done [with the tour] to try and finish, but business started moving so quickly that it was more advantageous for me to start worrying about that instead. In addition, I started building a little DJ family there and teaching kids how to DJ for free. We got a nice little legacy and history of DJs from Howard University, especially over the last 15 years.

When did you find out who won the election? When were you confirmed to DJ these events?

People had an idea of [the loss], as the event was going along, but we knew before we left. I was confirmed that morning to do the event, or the day before honestly. We had been in conversation for a second, but it wasn't a guaranteed thing. I asked as soon as I found out [about where Vice President Harris would be spending election night]. It had to go through a couple of channels. I got lucky because I was invited to the Vice President's mansion earlier this year for a celebration of HBCU leaders, and we got a picture together. I'm not gonna say we were on a first-name basis, but she had a nice reference for me just in case somebody asked her about [potential DJs].

The day before the Election, one of the higher-ups got in contact with me and said, “Hey, we heard you've been chosen to DJ the event. Can you come set up the day before because they have to do several different sweeps?”

In addition, there was also a completely different watch party that was supposed to be happening at the same time in the gymnasium and they sent all those kids to the yard. The DJ from the gymnasium, DJ K.Dimes, came up to me during the Election Night event and told me that they shut down the stadium. [The Harris team] wanted everybody to get the experience. As soon as he told me that, I made sure he got to get a picture and play a song or two; now he was part of history as well. We try to lift as we climb.

I got confirmed to DJ before her concession speech at 2:00 am on Wednesday. They said they enjoyed my energy and what was going on at the rally, and they wanted me back for the next day. Before they even got any words out, I told them, “Instead of trying to force dancing on this day, can we keep things a little more mellow and can we look to tell more of a story?” They were okay with it, and I had to send in a playlist the day before.

I put about 150 extra songs on the playlist. I sent over nearly 500 songs in total — you're potentially playing for a seven-hour period. As a DJ, there is no “travel light,” you gotta pack everything.

How much did the decision of the election influence the kind of set you created going into the concession speech yesterday?

We had an idea that things were not right when they started playing the CNN video and she was already down like 80 points. There were seeds of doubt being sown at that moment. People were still hopeful and resolute because they knew what happened in 2020 with a lot of states [going] blue later on, but it really felt like an uphill battle.

I wanted to go in and tell a story about perseverance with the music. I wanted to tell a story about making a way out of no way. My Election Night set was a little more energetic due to the circumstances, and the following day had to be a bit more mellow. I still got some energetic records in there, but it was definitely different.

How did you understand your role and responsibility as the literal master of ceremonies preparing the crowd for an emotional and historic concession speech?

Have you ever buried a relative? It's honor and it's duty, but at the same time, it's extreme sadness, heartbreak, gut-wrenching, all the superlatives you hear in the movies.

I have so much respect for Kamala [Harris], because she said, “Win or lose, I'm going down with the gang. I'm coming back home. Win or lose, I'm talking to my people and I'm talking to them at the place where everything first started.” I more than empathize with that. I wanted to make sure her transition, whether it was in or out, was met with nothing but love.

This Howard thing… people talk about it abstractly, but it's real. She and I are both Howard students from California. We had to come from a long way to get where we are. We're doubly connected. Outside of the exposure, I wanted to be there to make sure my sister was good. I wanted to make sure she was okay. She fought her life out for the last 100 or so days for us. When everybody else was telling her what to do and when she was doing everything in her power to make something shake, nobody had her back. So, I had to make sure we had her back.

On X, you wrote , “We use music to tell a story. Glad I could include mine.” What were the parts of your specific story that you were plugging into the setlist?

One of the first songs I got off that day was “Changes” by 2Pac, and one of the verses starts off with “I see no changes, all I see is racist faces/ Misplaced hate makes disgrace to races.” I started off preaching. Then, I played Chaka Khan's “What Cha' Gonna Do For Me?” and Hall & Oates' “I Can't Go for That.” A lot of those are self-explanatory, like, personally, I'm not going for no Trump presidency. You gotta ask Trump what he's gonna do for me! And that can go both ways because what are we gonna do for Kamala now that the chips are down?

I actually wanted to play The Isley Brothers' “Shout” the day prior, but it was too old for the crowd. We had a really young crowd on Election Night. There were a lot of older people there, but the young folks showed up for Kamala in droves. I played Victoria Monét 's “On My Mama,” because they call her “Momala” or “Big Mala” sometimes, so I wanted to make sure she was comforted. You could hear it in her voice – not saying that she couldn't handle that moment, but if you could be anywhere in the world other than this specific place right now, I'm sure you'd want to be there.

I added a few extra songs that I played that weren't on the approved list. I remember one of the DJs that I brought up was trying to play Soulja Boy and I was like, “Ay, turn that s—t off!” [ Laughs. ] I love you to death, but if the [artist] ever said anything stupid in public, we gon have to drain the swamp on that one! No Soulja, no Chris Brown … Bobby Brown didn't even make it through testing.

Who made that call?

我不做这些决定。 I don't have that type of power. I spent seven or eight hours on the initial list making sure it was curated perfectly without any abusers, fascists, etc. When [her team] sent the list back, they only took off one name and it was Bobby Brown. I was able to play Chaka Khan and even Janet Jackson if I wanted to – I didn't because [Jackson] had said something kinda goofy about Kamala.

What did you see on the crowd's faces from your vantage point?

It was like a third homecoming. The energy out there was electric. It was even more hilarious with the random rally-goers and people who had never been around HBCU folks or Black people because they were like “What the hell is going on?! Why are they playing this song?”

There were even staff members asking me, “Can you play a dancing song?” And I'll tell them, “This is the dancing song! This very slow Tamia song is the dancing song.” Women of all ages are moving to this one, and they will not get tired; they'll do the song for nine minutes if they need to.

I played so much s—t on Election Night. We went around the world. I was playing calypso, soca, go-go, East Coast, West Coast, Midwest, Dirty South – I did a lot of Afrobeats on both days. For the concession speech, I played Asake 's “Organize,” and I thought it was really important for the movement moving forward. In order for us to do what we need to do, we need to get organized quickly.

On Election Night, people came in excited, and they got their hearts broken. Before the concession speech, people came in with their hearts already broken. You could see it on their faces. It was like trying to lift somebody out of despair, and they don't wanna leave that [emotional] space just yet.

I almost felt like I lost the election, like I let y'all down.我正处于其中。 When s—t really started getting bad — after 11:30 pm, around midnight — they was asking me to play hype, dance, rally stuff. 我是！ And I was upset because they did a whole ESPN thing on this s—t and they got somebody on there who was on a whole different radio station at the time and damn near 50-60 years old – n—a, you wasn't playing no “Swag Surf!”

I guess they went back for vacation and when they came back [Fast Life Yungstaz's] “Swag Surf” was a big thing – and I wanted to make sure I was on top of it. I was breaking all the s—t. Everybody wanted to go more mainstream, and I was really trying to break that underground.

If I remember correctly, Obama was already president, and his brother-in-law, Michelle's brother, is the head coach at Morgan State University. They devised this plan where Morgan ended up playing Howard every year at Howard, and Obama started coming to campus once a year just for a basketball game. There were some songs I broke at Howard and some songs that I was the first to play in general. Like “Country S—t” by Big KRIT — we was beating down his DJ's email because we wanted to play it, and it wasn't in any record pool. He emailed us the studio version and the clean version, and I was one of the first people to ever play that record. Dom Kennedy wasn't even trying to get on the radio, and he sent me a clean version of “1997.” That Howard legacy runs deep!

Sony Music Publishing elevated Racheal Conte to vice president of sample clearance, legal and business affairs. She'll also collaborate with global offices to streamline sample clearances for US-based works, reporting directly to Peter Brodsky, evp of business and legal affairs and general counsel, from New York.孔戴（Conte）于2006年加入了SMP，并担任了各种角色，最近是样本清算助理总监。 “Racheal's contributions have been key to the success of SMP's songwriters and catalogs, and it has been rewarding to see her growth as a leader throughout her time at the company,” said Brodsky.

RADIO, RADIO : iHeartMedia laid off dozens — hundreds, according to reports — of staffers from radio stations around the country . Among the impacted in the sweeping cuts are regional presidents Matt Scarano (Chicago), Clyde Bass (Texas/Arkansas), Alan Chartrand (Boston) and Michael Burger (Raleigh), among others … Back at the home office, iHeart elevated Jordan Fasbender from general counsel to chief legal officer, with the former 21st Century Fox exec retaining her other titles of evp and corporate secretary … Audacy hired senior vp of research and insights Ray Borelli , who arrives after working as Warner Bros. Discovery vp of ad sales research.

Emily Crews , former vp of brands and synchronisation at Warner Music Australia, joined Level Two Music as head of partnerships.从她在华纳（Warner）的时间开始，她在同步许可和艺术家品牌合作中带来了丰富的经验，在此之前是通用音乐。 The Sydneysider said she's excited about Level Two's dynamic and thoughtful approach to music supervision, while managing director Jen Taunton praised Crews' ability to “navigate through often complex and layered deals, always managing to find the 'sweet spot.'”

洛杉矶营销代理机构通过媒体的媒体游戏名为Gavrielle Chavez为首席运营官。查韦斯将监督在录音室，游戏中的游戏，游戏唱片和新的配子平台的游戏中监督运营。她的角色强调，在下一代社区内的覆盖范围不断扩大，并加强了该公司的粉丝参与，最近的项目包括针对大肖恩，幼稚的甘比诺，Imagine Dragons和Tyla的运动。 Chavez previously worked at Scopely, where she led product marketing for the popular game Monopoly Go! , and before that was a creator strategic at TikTok, where she launched TikTok Shop and fostered partnerships between gaming brands and creators. Founder Anthony Pisano said Chavez's experience at Scopely and TikTok align with Game Over Media's vision, adding “Gavi's expertise will also be invaluable as we scale GameTune, our new cutting-edge AI platform that empowers record labels, brands, and gaming publishers to reach their audiences through strategic, data-driven marketing.”

Kuke Music Holding Limited , a NYSE-listed classical music service based in China, announced that its president, Li Sun , resigned in July.
